Execute SQL in a project. Go to "Data Studio" -> "SQL Editor", write your query and then click "Export as cURL"

Find more: https://docs.sentio.xyz/reference/data#sql-api

get.summary: Get a list of metrics in a project

post.description:
The easiest way to build query is through UI, you could first create an insight chart, and then **Export as cURL**.

![screenshot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sentioxyz/docs/main/.gitbook/assets/image%20(101).png)

get.description:
GetPrice returns the price of a given coin identifier, in a best effort way.
If we do not have any price data for the given coin, we will return NOT_FOUND error.
If we have at least one price data for the given coin, we will return it with the actual timestamp.
Client is responsible for checking the timestamp and decide whether to use the price or not.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description:
The timestamp we request the price at. Note, the price service may not have
the price at the exact timestamp, in which case it will return the price
at the closest timestamp.

post.description:
adds a coin by its coingecko id.

coingecko id the API ID of the coin in coingecko web page.

please AWARE that the coingecko id is NOT the same as the symbol of the coin.

![screenshot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sentioxyz/docs/main/.gitbook/assets/coingecko_apiid.png)

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
- ACTIVE: Only active version
 - PENDING: Only pending versions
 - ALL: All version

post.description:
Create a new transaction simulation. The simulation body should be included in the request body.
Your simulations will be saved, and a unique ID for each simulation is included in the response. It will be useful for fetching simulation details.

parameters.name: withInternalCalls
parameters.description: Fetch the decoded trace, which will give you the function info, decoded parameters of both external and internal call trace.

parameters.name: disableOptimizer
parameters.description: Disable optimizations to make internal calls more accurate, but gas costs will differ from the actual execution.

post.description: You could also create bundle simulations so that one transaction could be executed one after another. For `blockNumber` `transactionIndex` `networkId` `stateOverrides` and `blockOverrides` fields, only the first simulation takes effect.

get.description:
API to get Sentio call trace. It takes `txId.txHash` and `chainSpec.chainId` arguments, where the first is transaction hash, and the second is the numeric ethereum chain ID.

The results looks very similar to the normal [Ethereum call trace](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sentioxyz/docs/main/.gitbook/assets/image%20(2)%20(1)%20(1)%20(1).png). But we have an additional `startIndex` and `startIndex` on each trace entry even for the LOG, representing the execution order in the trace.

This allows you to build chart that marks the order of fund flow.

![screenshot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sentioxyz/docs/main/.gitbook/assets/image%20(2)%20(1)%20(1)%20(1).png)

parameters.name: withInternalCalls
parameters.description: Fetch the decoded trace, which will give you the function info, decoded parameters of both external and internal call trace.

parameters.name: disableOptimizer
parameters.description: Disable optimizations to make internal calls more accurate, but gas costs will differ from the actual execution.

ruleId.title: can be valid alert id or empty meanning match all alerts

group.title: if alert id is empty, then group could be used to select a list of alerts

active.title: unmute api will make it inactive

projectId.title: use project id if project_owner and project_slug are not provided

version.title: version of the datasource, default to the active version if not provided

projectId.title: use project id if project_owner and project_slug are not provided

version.title: version of the datasource, default to the active version if not provided

name.description: the name of the query, if sql is empty and name not empty, the query will be fetched by the name.

queryId.description: the id of the query, if sql and name both empty, the query will be fetched by the id.

cacheTtlSecs.title: how long the cache will be stored before it is evicted

cacheRefreshTtlSecs.title: how long the cache will be refreshed in the background

namespaceCode.title: additional codes definted in the namespace

common.Formula.description: the formula to combine multiple queries
common.Formula.title: formula

slug.title: {ownerName}/{slug} is the unique name of the project

query.title: the promql query or the metric name

disabled.title: hide the result, usually used for formula, default is false

common.Query.description: the query to fetch metrics data, promql
common.Query.title: Metrics query

externalDocs.description: Find more about prometheus query language here.

common.Selector.title: TODO maybe MetricQuery should use this as well

common.Selector.OperatorType.description:
- GT: Numeric operators
 - CONTAINS: String operators
common.Selector.OperatorType.title: TODO add Date Value and List Value and its data type

common.SelectorExpr.title: TODO migrate segmentationQuery to use this

values.title: JoinOperator operator = 2; // this field should implement in the future

interval.title: TODO remove step in favor of interval

step.title: interval in seconds between each data point

common.TimeRangeLite.description: start and end time of the time range, Find more: https://docs.sentio.xyz/reference/data#time-range-configuration-guide
common.TimeRangeLite.title: Time range

externalDocs.description: Find more about time range here.

specifiedAt.title: optional, if not specified, it will use block_time in eventlogs

common.UserInfo.description: The same to user but with sensitive data removed.

projectId.title: use project id if project_owner and project_slug are not provided

version.title: version of the datasource, default to the active version if not provided

dataSource.title: type of the data, can be METRICS, EVENTS, PRICE, FORMULA, COHORTS

sourceName.title: source name for the query, used when data is from a external project

matrix.title: TODO(chen@sentio.xyz): should use common.Matrix in the future

price_service.BatchGetPricesRequest.title:
GetPricesRequest is the request for GetPrices.
return every price on every given timestamp (if exact exists) for the given coin

price_service.CoinID.AddressIdentifier.description:
The coin can be defined as a symbol, e.g. BTC, ETH, etc, or an address + chain.
The format of the chain is consistent with the Sentio internal representation.

timestamp.description: The actual timestamp of the price returned.

price_service.GetPriceResponse.description: GetPriceResponse is the response for GetPrice.

coinAddressesInChain.title: map from symbol to address, only returned when chain is set

processedBlockNumber.description: The most recently processed block number and block hash.

trackers.description: To be deprecated after the migration.

errorRecord.description: This field is set if state is ERROR.

processor_service.GetProcessorStatusRequ.title:
- ACTIVE: Only active version
 - PENDING: Only pending versions
 - ALL: All version

errorRecord.description: This field is set if state is ERROR.

projectId.description: The project this processor belongs to.

version.description: The version of the code_url below.

sdkVersion.title: The SDK version used when uploaded

codeUrl.description: Call should be able to fetch the code to run from code_url.

chainStates.title:
Each maintains a state of a processor w.r.t a given chain.
This is a one-to-many mapping (processor to processor-chain)

contractId.description: If non empty, this is the contract associated with the processor.

debug.title: If enabled, driver job's log level will be set to debug

timescaleShardingIndex.description: The timescale-db sharding index of this processor.

versionLabel.title:
The version label of the subgraph
used for subgraph project

ipfsHash.title:
The hash (object CID) of the subgraph description file in ipfs node
used for subgraph project

debugFork.title:
ID of a remote subgraph whose store will be GraphQL queried
used for subgraph project

createdAt.description: The created timestamp of the processor.

clickhouseShardingIndex.description: The clickhouse sharding index of this processor.

k8sClusterId.title: The k8s cluster id of this processor

processor_service.Processor.description: This represents a processor which backend works on.

preprocessKey.title: always set, even if not preprocessed, pass the key to debugger to store

compilationKey.title: If it's already preprocessed, compilation key will be empty

type.title: Currently only external fork is supported

chainId.title: we should use chain_id in favor of network_id

simulations.description: For blockNumber, transactionIndex, networkId, stateOverrides and blockOverrides fields, only the first simulation takes effect.
For blockNumber, transactionIndex, networkId, stateOverrides and blockOverrides fields, only the first simulation takes effect.

dashboardId.description: The id of the target dashboard to import into.

dashboardJson.description: The json data of a previously exported dashboard.

overrideLayouts.description: Override the layout of target dashboard.
